name: Nicergoline
summary: An ergot derivative used to improve cognitive function and cerebral blood flow, primarily in vascular dementia and age-related cognitive decline.
description: Nicergoline is a semisynthetic ergot alkaloid that acts as an alpha-adrenergic antagonist, increasing cerebral blood flow and enhancing neuronal metabolism. It has been used for cognitive impairment due to vascular causes, age-related memory loss, and other neurological conditions. It is not approved in the United States but is prescribed in several European and Asian countries.

items: Acute and chronic cerebral vascular insufficiency

sections.text: Blocks alpha-1 adrenergic receptors, leading to vasodilation and improved blood flow to the brain. Enhances glucose and oxygen utilization in neurons and protects against oxidative stress.

adult.range: 10–30 mg twice daily depending on condition and tolerance

sections.geriatric: Lower initial doses recommended (e.g., 5–10 mg twice daily)
sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; consider dose reduction

sections.text: Gradual onset over weeks; benefits may take 1–3 months to become apparent.

other: Avoid in patients with acute bleeding risk
May interact with antihypertensive drugs, increasing risk of hypotension

items.risk: Increased risk of vasospasm or fibrosis

sections.lactation: Unknown excretion in breast milk; avoid use

sections.text: No specific withdrawal syndrome reported; may taper gradually to monitor for symptom recurrence.

items: Not approved in the US; used in parts of Europe and Asia
May have mild nootropic and neuroprotective effects
Often used in combination with other cognitive enhancers in some countries

seo.description: Nicergoline is an ergot-derived alpha-blocker that improves cerebral blood flow and cognitive function, used for vascular dementia and age-related memory decline.
